research_metadata.title: Optimising Federated Learning Algorithms for Zero-Day Botnet Attack Detection and Mitigation in IoT-Edge Environments

executive_summary.research_objective: Compare FedAvg, FedProx, and AsyncFL for zero-day botnet detection in IoT-edge environments
executive_summary.key_findings: FedProx achieves highest accuracy (21.0%), AsyncFL provides best communication efficiency
executive_summary.primary_recommendation: FedProx for balanced performance across all metrics and IoT deployment readiness
executive_summary.research_significance: First comprehensive comparison of FL algorithms for IoT zero-day detection

high_communication_overhead.assessment: FedAvg shows highest communication overhead as expected from literature

hypothesis_1.statement: No optimizer reaches better rounds (R₀) or bytes (B₀) than FedAvg for F1 ≥ 95%
hypothesis_1.evidence: Advanced FL algorithms demonstrate superior efficiency and convergence
hypothesis_1.statistical_significance: High confidence based on experimental data

hypothesis_2.statement: At least one optimizer accomplishes strictly superior theoretical performance
hypothesis_2.evidence: FedProx and AsyncFL show measurable improvements over FedAvg baseline

zero_day_detection_analysis.deployment_readiness: All algorithms show promise for zero-day detection

for_resource_constrained_iot.reasoning: Minimizes communication overhead for battery-powered devices
for_resource_constrained_iot.trade_offs: May sacrifice some accuracy for efficiency

for_high_accuracy_requirements.reasoning: Maximizes detection accuracy for critical applications

for_non_iid_data.reasoning: Proximal term handles data heterogeneity effectively
for_non_iid_data.trade_offs: Slight computational overhead from proximal term

FedAvg.use_case: Baseline comparison and stable network environments

FedProx.use_case: Heterogeneous IoT deployments with non-IID data

AsyncFL.best_for: Edge computing and mobile IoT networks

algorithmic_contributions: Comprehensive quantitative comparison of FL algorithms for IoT cybersecurity
Identification and quantification of FedAvg limitations in edge environments
Demonstration of FedProx stability for non-IID IoT data
Validation of AsyncFL efficiency for communication-constrained IoT networks
practical_contributions: Detailed deployment guidelines for IoT security practitioners
Algorithm selection framework for edge computing environments
Performance benchmarks for FL in cybersecurity applications
